item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, April 13, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Dark Side of the Moomins (40 points | 6 comments)
2. Whenever – typed and DST-safe datetimes for Python (136 points | 48 comments)
3. Philip K. Dick: Stanisław Lem Is a Communist Committee (92 points | 22 comments)
4. Wasting Inferences with Aider (3 points | discuss)
5. BPS is a GPS alternative that nobody's heard of (282 points | 103 comments)
6. How I install personal versions of programs on Unix (13 points | 7 comments)
7. Show HN: Chonky – a neural approach for text semantic chunking (88 points | 19 comments)
8. Experimental release of GrapheneOS for Pixel 9a (294 points | 160 comments)
9. Nice things with SVG (472 points | 81 comments)
10. WebTUI – A CSS Library That Brings the Beauty of Terminal UIs to the Browser (217 points | 70 comments)
11. AMD NPU and Xilinx Versal AI Engines Signal Processing in Radio Astronomy (2024) [pdf] (8 points | discuss)
12. How to not build a two stage model rocket (86 points | 22 comments)
13. Emacs Lisp Elements (286 points | 41 comments)
14. Nominal Aphasia: Problems in Name Retrieval (21 points | 10 comments)
15. I ditched my laptop for a pocketable mini PC and a pair of AR glasses (241 points | 158 comments)
16. Go channels are bad (2016) (80 points | 51 comments)
17. Open source and self hostable/private file converter (539 points | 104 comments)
18. YAML: The Norway Problem (2022) (176 points | 108 comments)
19. Cross-Entropy and KL Divergence (42 points | 3 comments)
20. Osprey – Browser extension that protects you from malicious websites (5 points | discuss)
21. RNA interference and nanomedicine team up to fight dangerous fungal infections (4 points | discuss)
22. Show HN: memEx, a personal knowledge base inspired by zettlekasten and org-mode (162 points | 29 comments)
23. A Farewell to the ArcoLinux University (63 points | 11 comments)
24. Why is there a “small house” in IBM's Code page 437? (176 points | 42 comments)
25. CERN releases report on the feasibility of a possible Future Circular Collider (114 points | 84 comments)
26. Microgravity 101 (21 points | 8 comments)
27. Dust in the wind: How cities alter natural airborne particles (37 points | 1 comment)
28. The Bitter Prediction (144 points | 113 comments)
29. ArkType: Ergonomic TS validator 100x faster than Zod (171 points | 59 comments)
30. Tunarr: Create and configure live TV channels from media on your servers (186 points | 50 comments)
